qas.question: What territory's constitution says "The death penalty shall not exist"?
What US state prohibits the death penalty in its constitution?
How many US states have passed laws outlawing the death penalty?
Under what jurisdiction can capital offenses still be committed in Puerto Rico?
What territory's constitution says "The death penalty shall definitely exist"?
What US state allows the death penalty in its constitution?
How many UK towns have passed laws outlawing the death penalty?
Under what jurisdiction can capital offenses never be committed in Puerto Rico?

context: <a0_0><b4_0>Puerto Rico's<b4_0/><a0_0/> constitution expressly forbids capital punishment, stating "The death penalty shall not exist", setting it apart from all U.S. states and territories other than <a1_0><b5_0>Michigan<b5_0/><a1_0/>, which also has a constitutional prohibition (<a2_0><b6_0>eleven<b6_0/><a2_0/> other states and the District of Columbia have abolished capital punishment through statutory law). However, capital punishment is still applicable to offenses committed in Puerto Rico, if they fall under the jurisdiction of the <a3_0><b7_0>federal<b7_0/><a3_0/> government, though federal death penalty prosecutions there have generated significant controversy.
